snippet: Officials of a police union that called for a strike charged that President Mohamed Morsi and his Islamist allies had used the police to beat back demonstrations by his political opponents.
abstract: Hundreds of police officers in Egypt shut down headquarters of Interior Ministry in at least seven provincial capitals across country in series of protests against what they call political exploitation by government of Pres Mohamed Morsi.
lead_paragraph: Officials of a police union that called for a strike charged that President Mohamed Morsi and his Islamist allies had used the police to beat back demonstrations by his political opponents.

headline.seo: Hundreds on Police Force Protest Egypt’s Government
headline.main: Hundreds on Police Force Protest Egypt’s Government
headline.print_headline: Hundreds on Police Force Protest Egypt’s Government
